DOC.brief_summary: The aim present study compare effectiveness two alignment sequence thermal activated archwires different Af temperature apply correction mandibular anterior crowding
DOC.brief_title: Alignment Efficiency Two Thermal Activated Orthodontic Archwire Sequences
DOC.detailed_description: A parallel randomized clinical trial conduct involve 42 patient age 15 25 year ( mean : 19.5 year ) require orthodontic treatment include correction mandibular anterior crowding . Eligibility criterion active caries , exemplary hygiene , non- extraction lower arch significant tooth size shape abnormality . Outcome : The primary outcome degree crowd measure plaster cast use Little 's Irregularity Index . The secondary outcome crowd survival time occurrence correction six-month period . Randomization : The patient randomly allocate different group use seal opaque envelope . Blinding : The patient blind group allocate . Intervention : Patients treatment pre-adjusted appliance ( 0.022 in- Roth prescription ) . Two nickel-titanium alignment leveling sequence employ - NiTi archwire : 0.012 0.019 X 0.025 ; thermal activate NiTi archwires : 0.018 0.016 X 0.022 different austenite finish temperature ( 37ºC 35ºC ) , form different study group .
DOC.criteria: Moderate mandibular anterior crowd ( crowd : 4 6 mm ) accord Little 's Irregularity Index Presence teeth low arch second molar , indication extraction low arch No need therapeutic intervention ( use intermaxillary elastic band , interdental wear , open NiTi spine , active lip bumper ) Absence systemic condition could affect tooth movement Absence significant tooth size shape abnormalities No history trauma history root resorption alveolar bone loss . Severe mandibular anterior crowding ( crowd : 7 mm ) accord Little 's Irregularity Index Absence teeth low arch second molar Indication extraction low arch Need therapeutic intervention ( use intermaxillary elastic band , interdental wear , open NiTi spine , active lip bumper ) Presence systemic condition could affect tooth movement Presence significant tooth size shape abnormalities History trauma history root resorption alveolar bone loss .
